learning_objective: Use an iterative process to plan the development of a program by including others' perspectives and considering user preferences.
topic: Healthy Cooking and Food Preparation Techniques
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is developing a healthy meal planning app. They are trying to code a system that will suggest cooking techniques based on the type of food item input by the user (e.g., 'vegetables', 'meat', etc.). Here is a simple version of Alex's code: Based on the code snippet, what would be a good test case to run to ensure that the app is suggesting appropriate cooking methods for different food items?",
    "Answer1": "CookingMethods('fruits')",
    "Answer2": "CookingMethods('water')",
    "Answer3": "CookingMethods('meat')",
    "Answer4": "CookingMethods('candy')",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "The test case using 'meat' as an input will adequately test the app's ability to suggest appropriate cooking methods. Alex's program doesn't currently have a branch for 'fruits', 'water', or 'candy', and so calling the function with these items as parameters won't verify the system's expected behavior.",
    "code_snippet": "action CookingMethods(text Food)\n    if Food = \"vegetables\"\n        output \"Steaming and Stir Fry.\"\n    elseif Food = \"meat\"\n        output \"Grilling, baking and broiling.\"\n    else\n        output \"Could not locate food item. Please try another.\" \n    end\nend"
}
